DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Investigational New Drug Or Investigational Medical Device Exemption Flag Food and Drug Administration Center Code GrantorCode
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.:Immunity from an obligation or duty.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true._One of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs.:A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._The code that represents the FDA center to which the IND or IDE was submitted.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Study Protocol Investigational New Drug Or Investigational Medical Device Exemption Flag

Concepts.definition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.
Immunity from an obligation or duty.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Property.preferredName: Food and Drug Administration Center Code
Property.preferredDefinition: One of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs.:A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: One of the agencies of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs.
A point or area that is approximately central within some larger region or structure.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that represents the FDA center to which the IND or IDE was submitted.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The center within the Food and Drug Administration that regulates biological products for human use under applicable federal laws. It protects and advances the public health by ensuring that biological products are safe and effective and available to those who need them. It also provides the public with information to promote the safe and appropriate use of biological products.

Concepts.longName: Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research
Concepts.definition: The center within the Food and Drug Administration that regulates biological products for human use under applicable federal laws. It protects and advances the public health by ensuring that biological products are safe and effective and available to those who need them. It also provides the public with information to promote the safe and appropriate use of biological products.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Center for Drug Evaluation and Research

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Center for Drug Evaluation and Research
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The center within the Food and Drug Administration that assures the safety and effectiveness of drugs that are made available to improve the health of people in the United States. It regulates over-the-counter and prescription drugs, including biological therapeutics and generic drugs.

Concepts.longName: Center for Drug Evaluation and Research
Concepts.definition: The center within the Food and Drug Administration that assures the safety and effectiveness of drugs that are made available to improve the health of people in the United States. It regulates over-the-counter and prescription drugs, including biological therapeutics and generic drugs.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Center for Devices and Radiological Health

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Center for Devices and Radiological Health
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The Center within the Food and Drug Administration that is responsible for regulating firms who manufacture, repackage, relabel, and/or import medical devices sold in the United States. In addition, it regulates radiation-emitting electronic products (medical and non-medical) such as lasers, x-ray systems, ultrasound equipment, microwave ovens and color televisions.

Concepts.longName: Center for Devices and Radiological Health
Concepts.definition: The Center within the Food and Drug Administration that is responsible for regulating firms who manufacture, repackage, relabel, and/or import medical devices sold in the United States. In addition, it regulates radiation-emitting electronic products (medical and non-medical) such as lasers, x-ray systems, ultrasound equipment, microwave ovens and color televisions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
